column5: Hey guys,  Hit up my favorite pike lake the other day for a late afternoon/ evening fish east of Sault Ste. Marie. Not a sole on the lake like usual and we landed quiet a few fish. The pike were taken on large Williams Woblers, #14 Husky Jerks and the very long and slender FL #18 (floating) Rapalas. Fish were very healthy looking as they usually are from this lake...          The best fish of the day.......      We have also been targeting walleyes the past few days pretty heavily. Fished hard and looked for big fish in 12-18 feet of water. Generally the fish that have been landed are coming in around the 21-23" range. Looking for the most part like this...    Until this hog hit......      Love to see these hogs swim away.........  Also have been putting a licking on the Spring Kings out in Superior.....but I dont have any pics so i wont get into that.....  Take care,  TDunn
Some nice fish there. The eyes are definitly starting to move into some of the areas I like to frequent.
Those are some REALLY nice fish...thanks for sharing!!!!
Solid fish guys.  Thanks for sharing!  How big is that last walter....8/9lbs?

27.50 inches...no weight taken....never took a girth measurement either.....It was taken from the st marys, so im sure you know how chunky those fish are... id give it a healthy 8 on the scale.... TDunn
Might be a mini report but those are MAXI fish!  Great pics. Thanks for sharing those.
Excellent report, pics, and fish!!!  Take your tourney logo with you sometime, Team Slammers could use a couple entries like that!!!

Would you mind sharing the lake info with us, you can PM if you prefer.  I just bought a 16 ft boat for the kids and me to go up there.  I have been fishing out of Chapleau area for years, and took my sons up last year for first time, and they loved it.  I am looking for good lakes for pike and walleye around the areas from Saulte st. marie to Chapleau.  Any help would be great, and if they have camping sites available would be great to know.  Just getting expensive going up and renting everything up there with two extra to pay for!  Thanks in advance.  Anyone else have any suggestions, i would much appreciate.  I know there are lakes everywhere up that way, but ones that you can get a 16 foot boat in and catch more than a few fish, the ones you show here are awesome!
Nice looking fish.  I do love the Sault and the quality of fish in the area.
Nice looking fish, that one walleye is THICK.  I wouldn't tell a soul where those lakes are!!!
Thanks for the pics,  Nice big gators!
Nice fish guys...I'll find em yet
WOW . great report. Some of those Pikeys are monsters. Keep it up  Pachone
i've been dreaming about the downtown eyes for the last week... gonna try and get out for a few nights next week...long live the clown xrap
GREAT JOB MAN!!!!! Nice fish you caught there. That pike you let go will be mine next!!!!
nice report, nice fish.you got em good. thanks for sharing. you do good job
DHJ10......deep husky jerk........xraps a killer too......  Thanks for the replys guys......   TDunn
